title: ietf-truststore

ietf-truststore:truststore.description: The truststore contains sets of X.509 certificates and SSH host keys.

expiration-threshold.description: The threshold specifies the number of days before the certificate expires to start sending expiration alarms. The alarm severity increases closer to expiration: WARNING when the certificate expires within the threshold MINOR when the certificate expires within 1/3 of the threshold MAJOR when the certificate expires within 1/6 of the threshold CRITICAL when the certificate expires within 1/30 of the threshold or 3 days, whichever is largest. This severity is used also after certificate expiration.

name.description: Name of the certificate revocation list.

crl.description: The binary data for the CRL, used when the CRL is manually installed.

uri.description: The URI of where to fetch the CRL. Only http:// and ldap:// are allowed. Example: http://crl.verisign.com/class1.crl or ldap://192.168.33.27/example_crl.crl

refresh-interval.description: The CRL refresh interval in hours.

downloaded-crl.description: Latest downloaded CRL from the configured URI.

certificates.description: A list of certificates. These certificates can be used by a server to authenticate clients, or by a client to authenticate servers. Each list of certificates SHOULD be specific to a purpose, as the list as a whole may be referenced by other modules. For instance, a RESTCONF server's configuration might use a specific list of certificates for when authenticating RESTCONF client connections.

name.description: An arbitrary name for this list of certificates.

description.description: An arbitrary description for this list of certificates.

name.description: An arbitrary name for this certificate. The name must be unique across all lists of certificates (not just this list) so that leafrefs from another module can resolve to unique values.

state.description: A disabled certificate is excluded from validation

crl.description: Reference to the CRLs to use for this certificate.

cert.description: The binary certificate data for this certificate.

host-keys.description: A list of host keys. These host-keys can be used by clients to authenticate SSH servers. Each list of host keys SHOULD be specific to a purpose, so the list as a whole may be referenced by other modules. For instance, a client's configuration might point to a specific list of host keys for when authenticating specific SSH servers.

name.description: An arbitrary name for this list of SSH host keys.

description.description: An arbitrary description for this list of SSH host keys.

name.description: An arbitrary name for this host-key.

host-key.description: The binary public key data for this host key.

raw-public-keys.description: A list of raw public keys. These raw public keys can be used by a server to authenticate clients, or by a client to authenticate servers. Each list of raw public keys SHOULD be specific to a purpose, so the list as a whole may be referenced by other modules. For instance, a client's configuration might point to a specific list of raw public keys for when authenticating specific TLS endpoints.

name.description: An arbitrary name for this list of raw public keys.

description.description: An arbitrary description for this list raw public keys.

name.description: An arbitrary name for this raw public key.

public-key.description: The binary value of the public key. The interpretation of the value is defined by 'public-key-format' field.
